title: Jonas Boeschemeier
text:
I am a PhD candidate in Energy Economics at the Center for Energy Markets at the Technical University of Munich. I study the role of electricity market design in the energy transition with a primary focus on locational and real-time pricing. Previously, I completed my undergraduate degree at Maastricht University and an MPhil in Economics at the Tinbergen Institute in Amsterdam.
Overall, my research applies tools of industrial organization to energy and environmental economics. Other research interests include industrial decarbonization, climate policy and international economics.
Feel free to reach out at: jonas.boeschemeier[at]tum.de

title: Research
text: My research applies tools of industrial organization to energy and environmental economics. Other research interests include industrial decarbonization, climate policy and international economics.

Designing Hedging Instruments for Locational Price Risks – Lessons from North America
